Stress in hospitals

How stressed are your employees? Do you know what impact it is having on them, on your patients and on your hospital’s budget? We surveyed one hundred thousand hospital staff to ask them how they experience stress at work. Stressed staff consume more alcohol. Let the facts speak for themselves.

Hospital staff recognised that stress was also having an impact on patient care. JUST GIVE THIS AS A GRAPHIC, WHAT PERCENTAGE. And yet according to those same staff, hospital management clearly doesn’t do enough to combat the problem. GIVE THIS JUST AS A PERCENTAGE FIGURE Aside from patient care and staff health, stress hurts a hospital’s bottom line through sick leave and high turnover. Demotivated staff is a problem concentrated in certain departments.

Whereas motivated, happy staff are significantly more likely to want to take on extra responsibilities, and even felt happy to work overtime. GIVE AS PERCENTAGE Do you want to know if your staff are at risk of stress and its negative impacts? Can you afford to ignore the problem? Head over to our predict page to find out how YOUR staff are feeling.
